importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article reflects the current state of humanitarian conditions in Gaza following the ceasefire, indicating the urgency of ongoing food delivery efforts.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The ongoing conflict and its humanitarian consequences span from 2024 to 2025, showing a prolonged crisis affecting food security and civilian lives.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are still significantly below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes delivered daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are currently operational, limiting humanitarian access.
The WFP has opened 26 food distribution points in Gaza, up from five, but still far short of the 145 needed across the territory.
Humanitarian aid has reached northern Gaza via southern routes, but not in large-scale convoys, and the main Salah al-Din Street remains closed to WFP operations.
The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is critical for sustaining aid delivery and preventing famine in northern Gaza.
Hamas has pledged to hand over 28 captives' bodies, having delivered 13 so far, with the Rafah crossing remaining closed until further notice.
Families in Gaza are rationing food and storing supplies due to uncertainty about the duration of the ceasefire and future conflict risks.
The US 20-point plan includes full humanitarian access to Gaza, which remains a key part of the peace and aid framework.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A United Nations agency responsible for delivering food aid to people affected by crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is central to the article as it reports on current food supply levels, distribution points, and calls for increased border crossings to meet urgent humanitarian needs in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Strip
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory under Israeli control, currently experiencing a severe humanitarian crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Gaza Strip is the primary location of the food crisis described in the article, where food supplies are critically low despite the ceasefire.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza in the southern region.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This crossing is one of the only two currently operational, playing a crucial role in food delivery to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza in the central region, known as Kerem Shalom in Israel.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This crossing is the second operational border point, contributing to limited but ongoing food supply into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south road in Gaza, currently blocked to WFP operations.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its closure prevents the WFP from using a key route to deliver food to northern Gaza, where needs are most urgent.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A crossing between Gaza and Egypt, currently closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The closure of this crossing limits humanitarian access to Gaza, especially from the southern region, and is dependent on Hamas returning captives' bodies.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and militant group controlling parts of Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas has committed to returning the bodies of Israeli captives, which is a condition for the reopening of the Rafah crossing and part of the ceasefire framework.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation that controls borders and security in Gaza, restricting access to humanitarian aid.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel’s control over border crossings and security policies directly determines the flow of food supplies into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: United States President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A political figure who brokered a ceasefire agreement in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump’s role in brokering the ceasefire and his 20-point plan for aid delivery makes him a central figure in the humanitarian response framework.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister who has stated the Rafah crossing will remain closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netanyahu’s position on the Rafah crossing closure reflects Israeli policy constraints on humanitarian access and peace negotiations.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A military wing of Hamas responsible for militant activities in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Qassam Brigades confirmed the handover of two Israeli captives' bodies, fulfilling part of the ceasefire conditions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The United Nations World Food Programme reports that food supplies to the Gaza Strip remain critically low, delivering only 750 metric tonnes daily—far below the 2,000-tonne target—due to just two open crossings: Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara. Despite expanding to 26 food distribution points, the WFP still falls short of its goal of 145 points across Gaza. Humanitarian aid has reached northern Gaza via southern routes, but not in sufficient quantities, and the main Salah al-Din Street remains closed. The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is seen as essential for saving lives and halting famine. Hamas has committed to handing over 28 captives’ bodies, having delivered 13, with the Rafah crossing remaining closed until further notice. Families in Gaza are storing food due to fears of renewed conflict, and the situation underscores the urgent need for more open crossings and sustained international humanitarian access.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
